title: Beneath Restless Skies
caption:
A few bumps in the field—pace beats push today.

— Kp 3.7  •  Bz -6.1 nT  •  Schumann 6.81 Hz
snapshot:
Space Weather Snapshot
Some texture in the field—small waves rather than a full storm. Drivers: southward IMF windows. Schumann resonance reads on the lively side at times, matching reports of vivid dreams or restlessness for some. Aurora chances look favorable at higher latitudes—dark skies after local midnight tend to help. Plan a steady rhythm; if you run sensitive, keep a quick breath reset and short movement breaks.
affects:
How it may feel
- Focus/energy: Bit of texture—aim for rhythm over intensity.
- Autonomic/HRV: Southward Bz or higher Kp can nudge HRV down in some; paced breathing helps.
- Sleep: Wind down on schedule; keep evenings warm‑lit.
- Clinician note: If you run sensitive, brief tingles or nerve heaviness can show—plan micro‑breaks.
- Comms/GNSS: Minor accuracy or HF variability is possible at higher latitudes.
playbook:
Care notes
- 5–10 min paced breathing (e.g., 4:6) or brief HRV biofeedback
- Hydration + electrolytes; short daylight exposure; gentle mobility
- Protect sleep: blue‑light filters and a consistent wind‑down
- If sensitive, quick grounding/outdoor walk; warm pack for nerve flare windows
